A search for inhibitors with broad antirespiratory RNA virus activity yielded the ribonucleoside analog N 4-hydroxycytidine (NHC), which showed oral efficacy against RSV and both highly-pathogenic avian and seasonal influenza viruses in mouse models.
90 Mechanistic characterization revealed that the compound is efficiently anabolized to the bioactive tri-phosphate form in ex vivo primary human airway epithelium cultures and in animal tissues, followed by incorporation as cytidine into viral RNA by influenza virus polymerases.

106 Additional studies have expanded the antiviral target spectrum of NHC to viruses of the flavivirus, alphavirus, coronavirus, and togavirus families, 107, 108, 109, 110, 111 demonstrating broad anti-RNA virus activity.
